altIdentifier.idno: In catalogue wrongly as HSk 1 fol.

titlePage.titlePart: DANSKAR og SVENSKAR Søgur; Sømuleidis Vidbæter af Alexander Mikla og Cyro Keysara. Skrifadar á Hlum í Hiallta Dal. MDCCLXXX Af P.I.S.

Sagann af ALEXANDRO hinum Mikla Fyrst i Latinskum ser Studla Versum Samanntekinn af PHILIPPO GALTERO INSULENSI Biskupi i Magalone Enn A Norrænu útløgd af Brandi II Jons Syne Aböta i Veri og sydast Biskupi A Hlum 1263 og 1264 Eptir Skipan Þess Agiæta Konungs i Norvege Magnusar Hakonar Sonar Lagabætirs
titlePage.note: Second title page on fol. 1r, which belongs to Alexanders saga, but was left out when the manuscript was bound and afterwards added to the front of the book, rather than to the story itself.

msItem.title: Table of contents
msItem.rubric: Þessar Sőgr hefr Bokinn inne ad hallda:
msItem.incipit: Hrolfe Gautreᴋssyne - " - " - " - " - " - " - " - Hálfdane Brőnufóstra Sørla Sterᴋa Haugna oc Hédinn Hrolfe Kraᴋa Harallde Hríngsbana Cyro Keysara Alexander Miᴋla

msItem.title: Gautreks saga
Gjafa-Refs þáttur
msItem.incipit: tilvinna, at þín Sæmd væri þá meiri enn ádr oc þiᴋez ec vita at Kongr mune sva vilja fyrer sitt Efne
msItem.explicit: enn ei er sagt hann være diúpvitur. hann var vinsæll oc stórgiőfull oc inn hæfverskasti ad siá,
msItem.finalRubric: Endar hier sva Geafa Refs þátt.

msItem.title: Hrólfs saga Gautrekssonar
msItem.rubric: Hier byriar siálfa Sőguna. XIte Cap.
msItem.incipit: Viner Gautreks Kongs rádlógdu honum, oc bádo þess at hann sᴋillde qvænaz, aptr
msItem.explicit: Kemr þad her framm at þad þijᴋest einn heyrt hafa, sem annar heyrer ecᴋe.
msItem.finalRubric: Lijᴋr her Saugu Hrólfs Kongs Gautreᴋssonar.

msItem.title: Hálfdanar saga Brönufóstra
msItem.incipit: Hringr hefr kóngr heitit, hann redi fyri Danmork hann var bædi vitr oc vinsæll.
msItem.explicit: attu Son er Hrdur het, hann var hinn mesti afreᴋs madur, oc var um sider unnenn med Hersᴋillde i Miᴋ Lagarde.

msItem.title: Sörla saga sterka
msItem.incipit: A þeim Tijma sem Hálfdan kóngur Brőnufóstre stírde Svi þiód hinne ᴋólldu er hann vann af Agnare hinum audga, Enn sette Astró mág sinn yfer England
msItem.explicit: ei er geted umm Bőrn þeirra,
msItem.finalRubric: endar sva Sógu af Sorla sterᴋa oc hanns afreᴋs-verᴋum.

msItem.title: Sörla þáttur
Héðins saga og Högna
msItem.rubric: Saga af Høgna og Hedinn, Frá Odni og Freyu.
msItem.incipit: Fyrir austann Vanaqvísl i Asia var ᴋallat Asia Land eda Asia Heimr, enn þad Folᴋ var ᴋallad æser
msItem.explicit: Enn Blód sast á Sverde, Ivars til merᴋia oᴋ alldrei hvorfu þar vardmenn sidann, for Konungr heim i Riᴋe
msItem.finalRubric: oc liᴋr þar frá þeim Hedinn oc Hógna at segia.

msItem.title: Hrólfs saga kraka
msItem.incipit: Madr er nemndr Halfdan enn annar Fróde, þeir voru brædr oc konga Sijnir oc styrdu synu Rijki hver þeirra
msItem.explicit: var haugur orpinn ijfir hrolf kong oc var lagt hiá honum Sverdid Skofnungur, oc nockur vopn hiá hverium;
msItem.finalRubric: Oc endar hier Saugu Hrólfs kóngs oc kappa hanns.

msItem.title: Haralds saga Hringsbana
msItem.incipit: Hringr hefr kongr heitit, hann var kappi mikill og Bardagamadr hinn mesti, sva fáa menn hafdi hann ser jafna fundit
msItem.explicit: oc átti einn Son er Catalactus het, er þar vard sidann ᴋongur epter Faudur sinn

msItem.author: Einar Bjarnason
msItem.title: Cyrus saga Persakonungs
msItem.incipit: Historia Valldstiórnar Uppbyriunar oc Endingar þess fyrsta Einvallds Dæmis, var firirmyndad med Gullhófdi Lykneskiunnar sem ɴebuchadnezar dreymdi
msItem.explicit: þessi Saga er útdreiginn af Sagnabókum Herodoti, Justini, Melosthenis Plutarchi og Xeonophonis,
msItem.finalRubric: oc lykur so frá Cyro meira ad segia.
msItem.colophon: Á Islendsku er þessi framanskrifud Saga utlógd af Æruverdugum Kienni manni Sal: Sa Einari Biarna Sijni ad Backa vid Geirlands , á Sijdu Austur.

msItem.title: Alexanders saga
msItem.incipit: ef þu ert scaumt i sama Stad, Optlega scaltu oc fylkia Lidi þino, at þat nemi Bardagalystir oc venist Vapnfimi.
msItem.explicit: er engi má honum at saunno Sacir finna játar hann oc engar á hendur ser, oc eigi mundi vera dæmt um mic her i Dag, nema
msItem.note: The title page for this item was left out when the manuscript was bound and was afterwards added to the front of the manuscript, rather than to the beginning of the story.

support.note: Fols. 2v and 96v are blank; fols. 1v and 3v were originally blank.
support.watermark: PROPATRIA ALR(?) and a knight with a lance, accompanied by a lion.

condition.p: When the manuscript was bound, the margins were trimmed very closely to the text. However, text is lost on fols. 12, 135-137, 139, 151 and 155-156 (side margins), on fols. 124-126, 141-142 and 148 (top margins) and on fols. 13-20, 68, 71-80, 87-92, 94-96, 99-109 and 114-123 (running titles). Fol. 125 has a frayed bottom margin and missing outer bottom with loss of text. Some leaves have paper strips pasted over frayed margins. These strips are now often very loose so that the text underneath them can be read. Fols. 1-3 were covered on their verso sides with other pieces of paper to support them; on fol. 1 there is red marbled paper and newspapers pasted on its verso side. On fol. 81r a piece of yellow transparent paper was pasted over a cut in the leaf. There is mould on the manuscript.

layout.note: Written in one column, except the verses on fols. 67v, 73r-v and 83v in 2 columns, with 32 to 46 lines per page, although usually with 38.
End of items written in half-diamond indention
layout.catchwords: Catchwords are on every page on fols. 4r-40r, 41r-v, 42r-55r, 56r-65v, 66v-70r, 71r, 97r-108r, 118r, 126v-136v, 137v and 138v-159v, and on every verso side on fols. 71v-95v and 109v-122v.

handDesc.handNote: Most likely wrote title page. Possibly 4 hands. According to a slip of paper that is kept with the manuscript, Pétur Jónsson í Svefneyjum wrote the title page.
Fols. 71r-96v and 109r-123v were written by Markús Þorláksson
Fols. 124r-138r:19 were written by hand C.
Fols. 138r:20-143v were written by hand D.

decoDesc.decoNote: Very ornamental title page. Baroque style with sumptuous thin line curls.
Ornamental text frame at the end of Cyro saga keisarasonar, 119v

physDesc.additions: On fol. 1v a large Do with decoration is added. On fol. 3r is added in the same hand as the rubric on this page: Vitnar sem hennar rettr Eigande Hoolum i Hialltadal d. 1. Apr. 1780. Petur Jonsson. Also on this page are single capital letters, SIGUR, Saganad, Sagann af Hogna, Jón Benidiktsson (same hand that wrote Saganad and Sagann af Hogna?), Hall and Sigriðu. Additions on fol. 3v: H, Halldór Jónssini and Hl Guðmundur. Fol. 70v: Halldor H Jonsson. Fol. 73r, between text: G mar. Fol. 82v-83r, bottom margin: han kunnu Godur. On fol. 84v there is a crude drawing of a masculine face in the bottom margin. Fol. 87r, between text: Hall. Fol. 90v, bottom margin: Si sig. Fol. 108v, bottom margin: Sigur. On fol. 123v the epitaph of Cyros is added by the scribe: Graf-Skrift Cijri keijsara. Hier liggur S mikli Cijrus, Otti og hrædsla allrar ɴordur og Austur-Alpu Heimsins. Underneath it is added in a different hand: Sᴋr. af Mr. Marc: þorl. S. Fol. 130v, bottom margin: nafm m. A small sheet of paper is added to the manuscript, written by sr. Helgi Konráðsson which reads Pétur skrifari Jónsson bóndi í Svefneyjum á 18. öld langalangafi Péturs á Slökkum hefur ef til vill skrifað titilblaðið. Höndin er lík segir P. á Slökkum Til er eftir Pétur skrifara Vídalínspostilla skrifuð 1734 á Hvallátrum. Gengur bökin i ættinni.

binding.p: Binding contains green marbled paper lining and black leather corners and spine. White paper used for inner lining.

provenance.p: Pétur Jónsson from Stökkum gave the manuscript to sr. Helgi Konráðsson in Sauðárkrókur. It is not sure how the manuscript came into Pétur Jónsson´s ownership, but it is likely that Jón Benediktsson, son of the provost Benedikt Vigfússon in Hólar, and his son Halldór Jónsson sold or gave it away when they emigrated to North America.

revisionDesc.change: Adjusted markup. Information on wpl and script type missing.
Added missing information from TL's files.
